name: Median from a list of data

skills.name: Calculate the median as an average from an odd numbered list of data
Calculate the median as an average from an even numbered list of data

explanations.A: Not quite. We are being asked to find the median, 5 is the mean.
explanations.B: As there are an odd number of numbers and these are already ordered, the median is the middle number which is 4.
explanations.C: Not quite. We are being asked to find the median, 2 is the mode.
explanations.D: Be careful. There is an odd number of data in this data set meaning there is only one number in the middle. To help, cross off your numbers, alternating between the largest and then the smallest, until you find the one in the middle.

explanations.A: Not quite. There are an even number of numbers in this data set which means there are two numbers in the middle. We cannot just pick one of them, we need to find the number that is halfway between them.
explanations.B: Not quite. There are an even number of numbers in this data set which means there are two numbers in the middle. We cannot just pick one of them, we need to find the number that is halfway between them.
explanations.C: Not quite. 4.5 is not the median. As this data set has an even number of data points the median is the number halfway between the two numbers in the middle.
explanations.D: As there are 6 numbers in this set, so an even number, we take the mean of the middle two numbers. The mean of 4 and 7 is (4 + 7)/2 = 11/2 = 5.5
